meanings.definition: To test or examine the quality or worth of something by comparison with something else.
meanings.sent1: I will coattest this cake by comparing it to the one I baked yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The students will coattest their science projects to see whose is the best.
meanings.sent3: Let's coattest who can jump higher by comparing our jumps!
meanings.sent4: She coattested her painting skills against the famous artist in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent5: The chefs coattested their culinary expertise in a cook-off.

meanings.definition: To compete or strive for superiority or victory.
meanings.sent1: The athletes will coattest for the gold medal in the upcoming race.
meanings.sent2: The two teams coattested fiercely for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: Let's coattest who can eat the most hot dogs in a minute!
meanings.sent4: The siblings coattested for their parents' attention by doing chores.
meanings.sent5: The companies coattested for the top spot in the market with innovative products.
